qas.question: In Cubism what was architechtural interested base on?

answers.text: the dissolution and reconstitution of three-dimensional form

qas.question: Who said that Cubism was becoming an influetial aspect in modern architecture ?
Increased use of what material marked Cubism influence in architecture?

plausible_answers.text: dissolution and reconstitution of three-dimensional form

qas.question: In Cubism what was not architechtural interested base on?
Who said that Cubism was not becoming an influetial aspect in modern architecture ?
Increased use of what material marked Cubism non-influence in architecture?

context: Architectural interest in Cubism centered on <a0_0>the <b3_0>dissolution and reconstitution of three-dimensional form<b3_0/><a0_0/>, using simple geometric shapes, juxtaposed without the illusions of classical perspective. Diverse elements could be superimposed, made transparent or penetrate one another, while retaining their spatial relationships. Cubism had become an influential factor in the development of modern architecture from 1912 (La Maison Cubiste, by <a1_0><b4_0>Raymond Duchamp-Villon<b4_0/> and André Mare<a1_0/>) onwards, developing in parallel with architects such as Peter Behrens and Walter Gropius, with the simplification of building design, the use of materials appropriate to industrial production, and the increased use of <a2_0><b5_0>glass<b5_0/><a2_0/>.
